exercises.title: DOM Manipulation: Simple Counter
exercises.description: Create a function `updateCounter()` that, when called, increases the numerical content of an HTML element with the ID 'count-display' by one. Ensure the initial state is 0 and handle potential NaN issues.
exercises.expected_output: The HTML element with ID 'count-display' will sequentially show: 1, 2, 3, ... after each click/call.

exercises.title: Algorithm: Array Deduplication
exercises.description: Write a function `removeDuplicates(arr)` that accepts an array of integers and returns a new array containing only the unique elements, maintaining the original order. You must achieve O(n) time complexity.
